userContext: Look at desktop-mode.html in C:\github\ai-assistant\www and work on a responsive layout that will always fit on mobile devices. It currently can sometimes overflow to the bottom depending on the content in the chat or the phone resolution when viewing the page. Do not break my styling please. results.planning:
UNDERSTANDING: User wants me to fix responsive layout issues in desktop-mode.html where content overflows on mobile devices, causing scrolling problems that depend on chat content and phone resolution. Need to maintain existing styling while ensuring mobile compatibility.

APPROACH: First examine the current HTML structure and CSS styling in desktop-mode.html, identify layout issues causing mobile overflow, then implement responsive design fixes using CSS media queries, flexbox/grid adjustments, and viewport-relative units while preserving the existing design aesthetic.

STEPS: 
1) Read desktop-mode.html file to understand current structure and styling
2) Use Grep to search for CSS classes and styling patterns related to layout containers
3) Identify specific elements causing overflow (likely chat container, input areas, or fixed height elements)
4) Analyze viewport meta tags and responsive design setup
5) Implement CSS fixes using media queries for mobile breakpoints
6) Adjust container heights to use viewport units (vh/vw) instead of fixed pixels
7) Ensure chat messages container has proper overflow handling
8) Test layout adjustments preserve existing desktop styling

TEST_CONSIDERATIONS: Will test responsive behavior across different mobile viewport sizes (320px, 375px, 414px widths), various chat content lengths (short/long messages, images, empty chat), and different mobile orientations (portrait/landscape). Will verify no horizontal scrolling occurs and all interactive elements remain accessible.

EVIDENCE: Will provide before/after code comparisons showing specific CSS changes made, demonstrate mobile viewport compatibility using browser dev tools simulation, and show that desktop styling remains intact while mobile overflow issues are resolved.

CONFIDENCE: High - This is a standard responsive design optimization task that can be solved with CSS viewport units, flexbox properties, and mobile-first media queries without breaking existing functionality.
